document.heading: Assisted Living Residence Regulatory Act of 2000

history.narrative: Law 13-127, the “Assisted Living Residence Regulatory Act of 2000,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-107, which was referred to the Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on January 4, 2000, and March 7, 2000, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on March 22, 2000, it was assigned Act No. 13-297 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-127 became effective on June 24, 2000.
